content:
Here is a possible structure for a 4.5-hour workshop on the fundamentals of coaching, aligned to the book "The Coaching Habit":

Time: 4.5 hours

Agenda:

1. Introduction (20 minutes):
* Welcome and introductions
* Overview of the workshop objectives and agenda
* Explanation of the coaching habit and its benefits
2. The 7 Essential Questions (45 minutes):
* Overview of the 7 essential questions from the book
* Group discussion and exercises to practice using the questions
3. Active Listening (45 minutes):
* Overview of active listening skills
* Group exercises to practice active listening
4. Giving Feedback (45 minutes):
* Overview of giving feedback effectively
* Group exercises to practice giving feedback
5. Coaching for Change (60 minutes):
* Overview of the coaching process for change
* Group discussion and exercises to practice coaching for change
6. Case Study (60 minutes):
* Provide the group with a case study and ask them to give feedback on how they would handle it
* Encourage them to apply the skills and knowledge learned in the previous exercises
* Allow time for group discussion and debriefing
7. Putting it all Together (30 minutes):
* Review of the key takeaways from the workshop
* Group discussion on how to apply the coaching habit in their workplace
8. Conclusion (15 minutes):
* Recap of the workshop
* Questions and answers
* Feedback and evaluation forms

Note: The above plan is a general format and can be modified as per the requirement and need of the group. With the additional time, you can provide more in-depth explanations and examples, and also provide more time for the group to practice and apply the skills learned in the workshop.
